p: The virus can be transmitted through body fluids. Transmission through oral or conjunctiva exposure is likely and has been confirmed in NHP (Jaax et al. 1995). Filoviruses are not naturally transmitted by aerosol. They are, however, highly infectious as breathable 0.8–1.2 μm droplets in laboratory conditions; because of this potential route of infection, these viruses have been classified as Category “A” biological weapons (Johnson et al. 1995; Leffel and Reed 2004) 2.
